column1: Interstitial cystitis is a long-term (chronic) problem in which pain, pressure, or burning is present in the bladder.
When your bladder fills up with urine, it sends a signal to your brain, telling the muscles to squeeze.

Common symptoms include: - Bladder pressure or discomfort (mild or severe) - Urge to urinate often - Burning pain in the pelvic area - Pain during intercourse Many people who have long-term interstitial cystitis are also depressed because of the pain and changes to their lifestyle.
During a cystoscopy, the provider uses a special tube with a small camera on the end to look inside your bladder.
